Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlayerDamagedListener, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener

    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, PlayerDamagedListener
    This class has the purpose of managing the game flow

      • candidateActions

        private java.util.stream.Stream<java.util.Optional<Tuple<CompoundAction,java.lang.Integer>>> candidateActions(java.util.List<BasicAction> playedActions,
                                                                                                              java.util.List<CompoundAction> compoundActions)
        This method returns a stream of Optional of Tuples of Compound Actions and an Integer, where the Tuple indicate in the compound actions the possible BasicActions that are available
        Parameters:
        playedActions - is the list of past played actions in this turn by the player
        compoundActions - is the list of CompoundActions the player can play in the macro action. It may depends from the different game mode or player situations
        Returns:
        a stream of Optional of Tuples of a Compound Action and an Integer, where the Tuple indicate in the compound actions the possible BasicActions that are available

      • candidateBasicActions

        private java.util.Set<BasicAction> candidateBasicActions(java.util.List<BasicAction> playedActions,
                                                         java.util.List<CompoundAction> compoundActions)
        This private method calculate the possible BasicActions the player can do
        Parameters:
        playedActions - is the list of actions done in this turn by theplayers
        compoundActions - is the list of possible compound actions the player can do in that particular macro action. They can variate from gaming mode to gaming mode or by the state of the player
        Returns:
        a Set of possible basic actions the player can execute
